entry.title: Re: Fiori - supplier Evaluation - No data available
entry.content:
Hi @Mahil @APY 

Hope the following will help you solve the issue. Thank you @APY  for raising it again.

The Fiori apps F1663A , F1661A , F1664A , and F2019 are analytical apps that rely on pre-delivered CDS Views and Analytical Queries.

When these apps show No data available, even after OData activation, it typically means that the underlying data sources are not filled or activated correctly.

 

Here are potential root Causes to Check:

  1. Analytical Query Activation
    • These apps run on CDS-based analytical queries for example C_SALESORDERITEMQRY, C_SALESDOCUMENTITEMQRY.
    • Please ensure that your queries are activated and released in your Public Cloud system.
    • In Public Cloud, this is done via delivered scope items. Make sure the correct Sales Analytics scope items for example 1S0, 2AN, 2QV, etc. are activated in your system.
  2. Business Roles & Authorizations
    • Check that your user has the right Business Catalogs:
      • SAP_SD_BCR_FIELDSALESREP_PC
      • SAP_SD_BCR_SALESANALYST_PC
    • Missing catalogs means the queries will run but return empty results due to restrictions.
  3. Underlying Transaction Data
    • These reports pull data from Sales Orders, Deliveries, Returns etc.
    • If your system only has customizing and no actual business documents such as SO, DN and Returns, then the queries will correctly return No Data.
  4. OData Service Binding
    • OData services like C_SALESORDERITEM_CDS must be active.
    • In Public Cloud, this is normally pre-delivered and auto activated but double check in the Communication Arrangement for Analytics.

 

Here is how you can resolve it:

First thing is to verify Scope Items. Make sure to check in Manage Your Solution app that Analytics for Sales (2AN) or relevant best practices are active.

Then test Queries Directly. Open app View Browser ‚Üí Search for C_SALESORDERITEMQRY and run it directly if no data, the issue is not with the Fiori app but with missing analytics activation or no transactions.

Finally create Sample Data. Make sure to create a test Sales Order and Delivery ‚Üí then rerun the app. If data now appears, it confirms the earlier runs were empty due to no transactional data.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Migration to SAP S/4HANA: What happens to VKM5?
entry.content: I have reviewed the content from the provided links and also the SAP Note, but it is still not completely clear whether VKM5 will become obsolete in S/4HANA. The development I am planning involves checking the customer‚Äôs credit limit through an external system via API at the moment of delivery creation. If no limit is available, the delivery should remain blocked in VKM5. If the VKM5 transaction is indeed going to be deprecated in S/4HANA, then my alternative approach would be to create a custom monitor. In this case, after consulting the external system, if there is no credit limit, the delivery would be blocked for billing through this new monitor instead.

entry.title: Re: Hierarchy totals agreggation display
entry.content:
Hi @Joao_Costa 

What you are describing is a planning aggregation problem: you want the year total to remain fixed at 0.20 even if monthly values do not add up for example Jan = 0.40 but year total should still stay 0.20.

 

Here is a Standard IBP Behaviour

  • By default, totals equal sum of child values for example Year equals sum of Months.
  • This ensures data consistency across levels.
  • Out of the box, you cannot break the additivity rule.

 

Here are potential options to Achieve your Requirement

  1. Key Figure with Exception Aggregation for Static Total
    • Create a new key figure that:
      • Has exception aggregation = Last Value or Fixed Value at Year level.
      • At month level, it stores your planning values.
      • At year level, it ignores the sum and instead displays a fixed total, in this case 0.20.
    • This way, Year total will always show 0.20, regardless of monthly entries.
  2. Disaggregation Setting
    • Set disaggregation so that when you change the Year, it spreads proportionally to months.
    • But in your case, you want the reverse to keep Year fixed while months deviate.
    • The suggested solution is, disable disaggregation for the Year level in this key figure ‚Üí Year stays static, months editable.
  3. Using Helper Key Figures
    • Here is the designated approach:
      • Key Figure A = Planned Monthly editable Values.
      • Key Figure B = Fixed Year Total which remains always 0.20, not additive.
      • Key Figure C = Reporting view that combines A monthly with B year.
    • This gives flexibility to plan freely in months but display a static year cap.
  4. Using Custom Business Rule
    • Use Planning Operators or a custom script in Advanced Planning to overwrite the Year total after each save. For example: after planning, force Year = 0.20.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Aggregation and Exception Aggregation

Planning View Behaviour in IBP

entry.title: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data
entry.content:
At a Glance: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data  

AI is only as powerful as the data it runs on. Inaccurate context, broken semantics, or outdated master data can turn automation from an advantage into a risk‚Äîcosting companies millions each year in delays, errors, and lost trust.  

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a trusted data foundation by preserving semantics, logic, and context of enterprise data. This eliminates manual data work, accelerates decision-making, and enables CFOs, COOs, and CIOs to act on accurate, contextual data.

Leading companies are already replacing manual workarounds with reusable data products, harmonized KPIs, and automated reconciliations.  SAP Business Data Cloud is launching a hands-on webinar series to help organizations unleash speed, trust, and impact with their data.

Learn more:Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

Full article: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data

Imagine an AI that automatically optimizes pricing to clear inventory while protecting margins‚Äîwithout human input. Now imagine that AI running on inaccurate data: the wrong currency, outdated master data, or misaligned cost centers. Suddenly, automation isn‚Äôt an advantage‚Äîit‚Äôs a risk. 

This is why data can no longer be treated as a back-office IT asset‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic business capability. The companies leading in AI aren‚Äôt the ones with the most data, but the ones with the right data, at the right time, with the right context. 

When Poor Data Foundations Impact the Bottom Line  

According to Forrester, poor data quality costs organizations over $5 million annually. Even more alarming, 7% report losses of $25 million or more (Forrester, 2024). Gartner research reinforces this reality.  In a 2020 study, Gartner found that poor data quality costs organizations an average of $12.9 million annually (Gartner 2020).  

It‚Äôs rarely the volume of data that slows organizations down‚Äîit‚Äôs the lack of business context. Poorly managed master data, disconnected hierarchies, missing lineage, and duplicated logic all contribute to fragmented views that undermine trust, delay decisions, and increase cost. 

The typical workaround? Manual fixes: recreating data context, writing custom scripts, and rebuilding SAP‚Äôs logic in other tools. These solutions are often fragile, expensive, manual and error prone. When systems change or org structures realign, the fixes can break‚Äîand IT has a new project all over again. 

The result: every decision takes longer, and every delay carries a cost. 

The consequences are real: 

  • Product profitability becomes unreliable if cost and pricing data use different hierarchies 
  • Regional forecasting fails when customer hierarchies are inconsistent 
  • KPIs vary between teams because each is working with different assumptions 

The impact on business leaders: 

  • CFOs risk inaccurate forecasts, delayed closes, and loss in profits 
  • COOs waste time waiting on reconciling reports instead of driving execution 
  • CIOs / CDOs see mounting costs as teams duplicate work, rebuild logic, and rely on shadow systems 

Leading companies are changing course‚Äînot by rebuilding data outside SAP, but by activating the trusted business logic already in place. 

Unleash Speed, Trust, and Impact with SAP Business Data Cloud  

SAP Business Data Cloud helps organizations turn fragmented data into a trusted foundation for decision-making. By unifying data across systems and preserving the business context that gives it meaning it significantly reduces the need for manual reconciliation or reengineering.  

The result is now reversed because the data is accurate, and actionable, enabling faster execution, stronger alignment, and higher return on data investments. 

How SAP Business Data Cloud strengthens enterprise data foundations: 

  • Preserve context natively: context, semantics, logic, and hierarchies stay intact‚Äîno rework needed. 
  • Deliver trusted, reusable data products: Instead of manually preparing data for every model or report, teams can access governed, curated assets that reflect real business truth. 
  • Empower intelligent applications: With high-quality, harmonized data at their core, applications for planning, forecasting, sustainability, and operations drive insights where decisions happen real time‚Äînot after the fact. 

Customer Transformation in Action 
Discover how leading organizations are transforming their business with trusted data. Here‚Äôs a collection of customer testimonials showcasing how SAP helps companies tackle opportunities across industries‚Äîwhether through modernization, real-time decision-making, or unlocking new growth powered by SAP Business Data Cloud. 

SAP Featured Stories for Business Data Cloud 

Experience SAP Business Data Cloud First-Hand:
To experience the power of SAP Business Data Cloud, join a hands-on webinar series designed to accelerate data strategies. Across a series of interactive modules, here SAP‚Äôs product and leadership teams guide participants through practical steps to unlock business value from their data.  

Topics include:  

  • Build and simulate outcomes with Intelligent Applications 
  • Accelerate AI innovation with SAP Databricks 
  • Create analytical models and data products in SAP Datasphere

Learn directly from some of the industry experts on how to turn data into a true business driver.

Learn more: Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Relationship WebService Inbound
entry.content:
Hello @Simon 

Thank you for the question and the screenshot. It is helpful.

The root cause seems to be that the relationship message can‚Äôt locate one or both partners in the key-mapping table, which leads to a failed lookup by Externalid. This results in the message: Unknown Business Partners / ID and UUID ‚Ä¶ missing.

What you should do

  1. Create both BPs initially through the BP inbound service using ExternalID and the same BusinessSystemID (your Salesforce logical system). Wait for successful creation, so key mappings are in place.
  2. Do not include Internalids in the relationship payload. Only send ExternalIDs along with BusinessSystemID for both parties.
  3.  Ensure that the BusinessSystemID / SenderBusinessSystemID in the relationship message exactly matches what you used for the BP creates, keeping in mind case sensitivity
  4. If the contact might not exist yet, wait to queue or retry the relationship until after the BP-create confirmation, or use InternalIDs if they are already available.

Minimal relationship references

<InitiatingBusinessPartner>

  <BusinessPartnerExternalID>SF-ACCOUNT-ID</BusinessPartnerExternalID>

  <BusinessSystemID>SALESFORCE</BusinessSystemID>

</InitiatingBusinessPartner>

<RelatedBusinessPartner>

  <BusinessPartnerExternalID>SF-CONTACT-ID</BusinessPartnerExternalID>

  <BusinessSystemID>SALESFORCE</BusinessSystemID>

</RelatedBusinessPartner>

<!-- + your RelationshipCategoryCode and Validity -->

Just make sure both mappings are in place and that you're referencing them using ExternalID along with the system ID.

Please feel free to use these official references for your work.:

  • Your exact error ID and UUID of Business Partner is missing‚Äù / ‚ÄúUnknown Business Partners ‚Ä¶ for relation when the partner can‚Äôt be resolved from key-mapping during relationship replication. (KBA; may require S-user) SAP Support Portal
  • Business Partner Integration (SAP_COM_0008) in S/4HANA Cloud; includes relationships. SAP Help Portal
  • SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol) inbound BP replicate service: BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In on API Hub for S/4HANA Cloud. SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • SOAP inbound BP relationship service: BusinessPartnerRelationshipSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In (used in Cloud). SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Manage Key Mapping app in S/4HANA Cloud (to see/maintain mappings used by the lookup). SAP Help Portal
  • BusinessPartnerRelationship concept page in the Cloud help.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Issue with Asset Acquisition via T-Code F-90 ‚Äì Balance Carryforward Not Executed
entry.content:
I am encountering an issue while attempting to post an asset acquisition using transaction code F-90. Upon execution, the system returns the following error:

 

"You cannot post to asset in company code fiscal year XXX. Diagnosis: Balance carryforward not yet executed for company code XXX."

 

To resolve this, I have attempted to run the balance carryforward process using both the SAP GUI (T-code FAGLGVTR) and the Fiori app ‚ÄúSchedule General Ledger Jobs‚Äù, but neither approach has yielded any results. The system does not display any balances to carry forward, as shown in the attached screenshot.

Despite verifying the fiscal year settings and ensuring the correct ledger is selected, the issue persists. I suspect this may be related to one of the following:

  • The balance carryforward has not been executed for all relevant ledgers, particularly Ledger 0L, which is commonly overlooked.
  • The closed fiscal year is not properly defined in the company code settings, especially in Asset Accounting configuration.
  • There may be a missing or incorrectly configured legacy data transfer segment, which affects how the system derives the current and closed fiscal years.

I would appreciate your guidance on how to proceed, particularly in verifying whether the fiscal year settings and ledger configurations are correctly maintained. If there are any relevant SAP Notes or recommended checks, please advise.

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Quota Payout on Termination
entry.content:
With your current payout being in time evaluation, the only standard way that I know to do this is use the operation UPDTQ. This operation can be used to reduce the entitlement. I don't like using this in most cases because it will reduce the entitlement, rather than increase the deduction. It is also not a very visible change meaning that if someone is trying to figure out why the entitlement is lower than expected, they have to dig into time eval results rather than having an entry in PT50 or in an infotype.

Have you looked into using dynamic actions to automatically create an IT0416 record during the termination action? 

Thanks,

Cindy

entry.title: How can I create a button that fully replicates Edit ‚Üí Reset in Analytics Designer?
entry.content:
I need a single button that returns the app to its initial state‚Äîexactly like Edit ‚Üí Reset. That means:

  • Clear all Input Controls (back to ‚ÄúAll members‚Äù)

  • Clear chart selections / Linked Analysis so app-level compound filters (e.g., ‚ÄúLocation + Company‚Äù) disappear from Applied to all pages

  • Remove all dimension filters from widget DataSources and File Data Sources

Questions

  1. Is there a supported API to trigger the exact same behavior as Edit ‚Üí Reset from a button?
  2. Is there any scripting API to iterate all dimensions of a model (not just those currently filtered) to ensure complete cleanup?
  3. Any official docs or sample implementations that demonstrate a robust ‚ÄúReset‚Äù button in Analytics Designer?

Thanks in advance for guidance!

entry.title: Re: Crystal reports; how to only include rows that have a...
entry.content:
Hi Ido - I thought my report was working correctly but it turns out that there's a glitch. 

The report uses a single table (MN_TIMESHEET), plus a second copy of that table (MN_TIMESHEET_1). That table includes fields for USER_NAME, BEGIN_DATE, and LABOR_ID, and it has a single parameter (begin date), for which I appended all database values. 

The purpose of the report is to list records where a given LABOR_ID value appears in multiple records.

And the solution you gave me mostly works, but for some reason the parameter doesn't list all begin dates. For example, the table includes records that have a begin date of 7/15/25, but the most recent date listed in the parameter selection screen (where I appended all database values) is 7/1/25. 

The selection formula is:

{MN_TIMESHEET.BEGIN_DT} = {?BEGIN DATE} and
{MN_TIMESHEET.ID}<>{MN_TIMESHEET_1.ID}

Do you know what I can do to ensure all begin dates are listed in the user parameter pick list?

entry.title: Approuter: Error getting client_credentials
entry.content:
We operate a multi-tenant solution on SAP BTP and rely on the @sap/approuter package as our initial entry-point which connects to the portal service and a number of Fiori Elements HTML5 applications hosted using html5-apps-repo services. This is a setup we have used for many years without any issue.

We recently bumped the version of the approuter package from 16.4.x to the 20.6.1 and after deploying this change in our production environment, we started getting reports of intermittent issues loading HTML5 apps:

I inspected the approuter logs and found that we had a number of errors matching this format:

Error getting client_credentials token for html5-apps-repo-rt from subaccount <tenant-subdomain>: 
HTTP response from https://<tenant-subdomain>.authentication.us10.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token was 401: 
{"error":"invalid_client","error_description":"Bad credentials"}.

 I referred back to the CHANGELOG.md for the approuter package and noticed that there had recently been some changes related to client credentials. I also noticed that a new version of the package was available (20.7.0) included a fix related to client_credentials and saas which I thought might address the issue we were experiencing:

- Read grant_type and saas.registry.enabled from service credentials in client_credentials token flow

We applied this update but are still experiencing the same behavior. 

I recognize that jumping multiple major versions (16->20) of a package has the potential for unexpected outcomes but the CHANGELOG.md did not have any indications that changes between any of these versions introduced major breaking changes. 

If anyone can provide any insights on how to proceed, it would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Why work order is not getting triggered from Ik11 for performance based plan?
entry.content:
Hello,

Appreciate for advice on this issue.

I created IK01 and assigned to equipment with annual estimate of 3650, and also created performance based plan with strategy assigned for 250 hours cycle. Scheduling period is 365 days and call horizon is 100%.

I entered counter reading 750 which means crossed 250 but work order not created. 

I checked IP10 and it gives all the planned dates and the earliest call date is after 25 days starting from today. Why work order not generated once the 250 hours was  crossed?

1) Performance plan with 250 hours interval/cycle

2) IK01 - Measuring point

3) IK17 - Entered all measuring readings

4) IP10 - Gives scheduled dates of 25 days interval..........WHY not work order generated even though 250 barrier crossed.

Thanks

Basil

entry.title: Good afternoon Devs, I need to create an abap code that goes into the /SCMTMS/TOR>ROOT node of BOPF
entry.content:
I think the idea is to take the shipment, which would be the tor_id, find the root_key, which is that giant key (example: A13066F447681FE095EED9D5AE2B2F33), and then generate a row in the /SCMTMS/D_TORBLK table with the characters filled in:

BLOCK_RC = Z1 BLK_PLAN = ‚ÄòX‚Äô BLK_EXE = ‚ÄòX‚Äô

entry.title: Re: Equipment master Configuration data update
